verbs.description: cognize (third-person singular simple present cognizes, present participle cognizing, simple past and past participle cognized)

entries.meaning: To know, perceive, or become aware of.
To make into an object of cognition (the process of acquiring knowledge through thought); to cogitate.
examples: Cognizing about mind is a ubiquitous human activity; we consistently construe each other as agents undertaking intentional action based on our underlying beliefs and desires (and not as "bags of skin stuffed into pieces of cloth")
